intro: Polygala exsquarrosa, commonly known as the woolly milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces small, bead-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Polygala genus. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
